intro: Pseudopimpinella anthriscoides, commonly known as the broadleaf cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitats.
